respStmt.name: Craig A. Berry, Martin Mueller, and Clifford Wulfman
Lawrence Berland, Hilary Bina, Katherine Gould, Kreg Segal, Nicholas Terrell

publicationStmt.p: The WordHoard Shakespeare is a joint project of the Perseus Project at Tufts University, The Northwestern University Library, and Northwestern University Academic Technologies. It is derived from The Globe Shakespeare, the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare, edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright (1891-3). The Internet Shakespeare editions of the quartos and folios have been consulted to create a modern text that observes as closely as possible the morphological and prosodic practices of the earliest editions. Spellings, especially of contracted and hyphenated forms, have been standardized across the corpus. The text has been fully lemmatized and morphosyntactically tagged.

Â© 2003. The copyright to The WordHoard Shakespeare is owned jointly by Northwestern University and Tufts University. The WordHoard Shakespeare is provided for free solely for non-commercial use by students, scholars, and the public. Any commercial use or publication of it, in whole or in part, without prior written authorization of the copyright holders is strictly prohibited.

castGroup.title: Twin brothers, and sons to Aegeon and Aemilia
Twin brothers, and attendants on the two Antipholuses

castItem.roleDesc: to whom Angelo is a debtor
wife to Aegeon an abbess at Ephesus

div.head: Act 1, Scene 1
div.stage: A hall in the DUKE'S palace.
Enter DUKE, AEGEON, Gaoler, Officers, and other Attendants.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 2
div.stage: Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Syracuse, DROMIO of Syracuse, and First Merchant.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 1
div.stage: The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 1
div.stage: Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus, DROMIO of Ephesus, ANGELO, and BALTHAZAR.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 2
div.stage: Enter LUCIANA and ANTIPHOLUS of Syracuse.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter Second Merchant, ANGELO, and an Officer.

wordHoardTaggedLine.stage: Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus and DROMIO of Ephesus from the courtezan's.
Enter DROMIO of Syracuse, from the bay.
Exeunt Sec. Merchant, Angelo, Officer, and Ant. E.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 2
div.stage: The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

wordHoardTaggedLine.stage: Exeunt Ant. S. and Dro. S.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 4
div.stage: Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus and the Officer.

wordHoardTaggedLine.stage: Enter DROMIO of Ephesus with a rope's-end.
Enter ADRIANA, LUCIANA, the Courtezan, and PINCH.
Enter three or four, and offer to bind him. He strives.
They offer to bind Dro. E.
Exeunt all but Adriana, Luciana, Officer and Courtezan.
Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Syracuse with his rapier drawn, and DROMIO of Syracuse.

wordHoardTaggedLine.label: 145F
wordHoardTaggedLine.stage: Exeunt all but Ant. S. and Dro. S.
Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Syracuse and DROMIO of Syracuse.
Enter ADRIANA, LUCIANA, the Courtezan, and others.
Exeunt Ant. S. and Dro. S. to the Priory.
Enter DUKE, attended; AEGEON bareheaded; with the Headsman and other Officers.
Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus and DROMIO of Ephesus.
Re-enter Abbess, with ANTIPHOLUS of Syracuse and DROMIO of Syracuse.
Exeunt all but Ant. S., Ant. E., Dro. S., and Dro. E.
Exeunt Ant. S. and Ant. E.
